The foreground of the photograph captures the image of three male workers standing on a rooftop of a flat. One of them is standing on a wheelbarrow with two wheels and holding onto the handlebars. In front of him, another worker is using a spade to work the ground. The background of the photograph shows several residential buildings, all in the various stages of construction and completion.
sgcool_label_text: Loke Hong Seng (b. 1943) was working as a radio announcer with Radio Television Singapore in the 1960s when he picked up photography and subsequently grew to specialize in street photography. His images of 1960s and 1970s Singapore offer a candid view of everyday life in the early days of the nationâ€™s development. This photograph shows workers at a HDB rooftop working on the construction of the Toa Payoh HDB new town. Newly constructed blocks can be seen in the background.
